skill.name: react-doctor
skill.description: Run after making React changes to catch issues early. Use when reviewing code, finishing a feature, or fixing bugs in a React project.
skill.summary: Automated React code diagnostics tool that identifies issues after code changes
skill.author: millionco

security_audit.summary: Static analysis found two patterns (external_commands, weak cryptographic algorithm) but evaluation confirms these are false positives. The external_commands finding is markdown documentation describing development commands (not actual execution). The weak cryptographic algorithm finding is likely a misidentification of normal text in the markdown file. This is a legitimate React debugging tool with no malicious intent.

medium_findings.title: External Commands Documentation
medium_findings.description: Static analyzer detected shell command documentation in SKILL.md - this is expected behavior for a development tool skill that describes what commands it runs
medium_findings.confidence_reasoning: Backtick syntax in markdown is documentation formatting, not actual shell execution. The skill describes running development commands which is legitimate.

low_findings.title: False Positive: Weak Cryptographic Algorithm
low_findings.description: Analyzer misidentified text in markdown as cryptographic usage - no actual cryptographic code exists in this skill
low_findings.confidence_reasoning: React debugging tool does not use cryptography. Analyzer likely misidentified a common word like 'hash' in normal documentation context.

content.value_statement: This skill automatically detects React code issues after changes, helping developers catch bugs early before they become problems.
actual_capabilities: Scans React code for common mistakes and anti-patterns
Detects performance issues in React components
Identifies missing dependencies in useEffect hooks
Checks for proper React hooks usage
Validates component prop types and prop drilling
limitations: Does not fix issues automatically - only reports them
Cannot detect runtime errors without executing code
May produce false positives in complex codebases

use_cases.title: Post-Feature Development Check
use_cases.description: Run after completing a new feature to catch any React issues before committing
use_cases.target_user: Frontend developers working on React projects

use_cases.title: Pre-Review Code Quality Gate
use_cases.description: Use as part of code review process to ensure React best practices are followed

use_cases.title: Legacy Codebase Audit
use_cases.description: Scan older React code to identify technical debt and potential bugs

prompt_templates.title: Basic React Check
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the react-doctor skill to check my recent React changes for any issues
prompt_templates.scenario: After making code changes in a React project

prompt_templates.title: Component-Specific Scan
prompt_templates.prompt: Run react-doctor on the Button component and its related files

prompt_templates.title: Full Project Audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Execute react-doctor on the entire src directory to identify all potential issues

prompt_templates.title: Fix Verification
prompt_templates.prompt: Use react-doctor to verify that my bug fix resolved the original issue without introducing new problems

output_examples.input: Use react-doctor to check my React component
output_examples.output:

best_practices: Run react-doctor after every significant code change
Review all warnings, not just errors
Use the skill early in development to prevent issues from compounding
Integrate react-doctor into your CI pipeline for automated checks
anti_patterns: Running react-doctor only when bugs appear (instead of proactively)
Disabling rules without evaluating the trade-offs
Relying solely on react-doctor without manual code review

faq.question: What is react-doctor?
faq.answer: React-doctor is a skill that analyzes React code to identify common mistakes, performance issues, and best practice violations. It helps developers catch problems early.

faq.question: Does react-doctor fix issues automatically?
faq.answer: No, react-doctor only reports issues. It identifies problems and suggests fixes, but you must apply the changes manually.

faq.question: Which React versions does it support?
faq.answer: React-doctor works with React 16.8 and later, supporting both class components and functional components with hooks.

faq.question: Can I customize which rules react-doctor checks?
faq.answer: Configuration options depend on the skill implementation. Check the SKILL.md file for available customization options.

faq.question: Is react-doctor suitable for TypeScript projects?
faq.answer: Yes, react-doctor can analyze TypeScript React projects and may detect additional type-related issues.

faq.question: How often should I run react-doctor?
faq.answer: Run react-doctor after every significant code change, before committing, and as part of your regular code review process.
